findings.rationale: A 30-day termination notice may disrupt business operations, especially if the Licensee relies heavily on the software.
findings.evidence_quote: Either party may terminate this Agreement with 30 days written notice for any reason.

findings.rationale: Limiting liability to the total fees paid in the last 12 months could expose the Licensee to significant losses in case of serious breaches.
findings.evidence_quote: Each party's liability is limited to the total fees paid in the 12 months preceding the claim.

findings.rationale: Confidentiality obligations lasting only 18 months post-termination may not adequately protect sensitive information in the long term.
findings.evidence_quote: Confidentiality obligations continue for 18 months after termination.
